intro: Conanthus jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican conanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Jamaica. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Conanthus jamaicensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
